inclusion.criterion: Eighteen (18) years of age or older
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patient is able and willing to give informed consent and follow protocol procedures,
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: and comply with follow-up visit requirements.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patient is determined to be at prohibitive risk for mitral valve surgery by the heart team (CLASP IID cohort only).
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patient is on stable heart failure medications/Guideline Directed Medical Therapy (CLASP IIF cohort only)
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Patient is determined to be a candidate for transcatheter mitral valve repair by the heart team for both PASCAL and MitraClip
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Suitable valve and regurgitant jet morphology
inclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Patient in whom a TEE is contraindicated or screening TEE is unsuccessful
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Mitral valve anatomy which may preclude proper PASCAL or MitraClip access, use and/or deployment or sufficient reduction in mitral regurgitation
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Patient with refractory heart failure requiring advanced intervention (i.e. left ventricular assist device, transplantation) (ACC/AHA Stage D heart failure)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Clinically significant, untreated coronary artery disease
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient has Marfan's syndrome and known severe mitral valve prolapse with regurgitation. She remains symptomatic and is now prepared to undergo mitral valve repair/replacement surgery.
